text: - Hello everyone. I'm Rahul Chugh.
I'm a Solutions Architect with AWS.
Today we have Rackspace with us,

one of our leading migration
and modernization partners.

We have Scott Branch here from
Rackspace to talk more about

what they're doing in migration
and modernization space

and how they can help you
take your workloads to AWS.
- Thank you, Rahul.
As he said, my name's Scott Branch.
I'm with Rackspace and I lead
our Migration Center of Excellence.
And today I'm here to talk about
the new Rackspace rapid migration offer

that I think will help
streamline migrations to AWS.
- Perfect, nice.
So Scott, could you tell us more about
how you built the business case

for the customers to
start the whole migration
and modernization process?
- Yeah, absolutely, yeah.
So as a AWS Premier partner,

we can do the whole
migration process end to end

and beyond from migrations
to modernization
and other services that we can do
to grow and mature your AWS footprint.
But really your journey into AWS starts
with two phases that we can help out with.

One is the OLA or Optimization
and Licensing Assessment

where we can look at
your licensing footprint

and really kind of your
whole data center footprint

really rapidly to just kind
of understand what is it
that you're migrating
and will you get any licensing benefits

by using new and different
services in the cloud.
So it's really above and beyond license,
but it's TCO
and a few other things that we can do
in that licensing assessment.
But this is a real quick and easy way
for us to understand what you're moving.
And then we can use the assess phase

to do a little bit more
planning for the migration.
So we are gonna build a migration plan.

And we'll do a deeper
dive analysis of TCO,
If there are complexities discovered,
we'll do a deeper dive analysis of TCO.
Maybe there's some other things that

within maybe only a couple
weeks doing the OLA real light
and efficient analysis,
we'll do some more TCO analysis as well.
But really we're building the plan
for migrating the rest of your workloads
in the assess phase.
And really what we're doing is,
really what we're doing is trying

to qualify customers
for the rapid migration.
And really a lot of it hinges on

how many of your workloads
are VMware or Windows.

And that's gonna be dependent
on how much AWS funding
that you can get for this migration

because of new funding
programs are related

to migrating VMware
workloads or Windows to AWS.

And so with that funding
mechanism that we can get

through AWS in this
qualification process is really

what drives our ability to
offer the rapid migration offer,
which the rapid migration offer is really

a zero cost offer that we're
pre-qualifying this for $0.
- Got it. All right.
So once you qualify your customers
for rapid migration offer,

how does their journey
look like with Rackspace?

- Yeah, so the journey
with Rackspace is really,
it's a bundling of ISV
or independent software vendor tools

and Rackspace services to
help you move your workloads

to the cloud more efficiently
with a management plane

and other things kind
of bundled in together.

So what we do with the
rapid migration offers is
we're gonna have Rackspace services
to go build out the landing zone.
So we'll build out that landing zone

to provide you a footprint in
AWS built on best practices.

And that's really like our
number one starting point
is having a footprint in AWS

that has networking, security,
centralized IAM, et cetera.

So that when you land
your workloads into AWS,

that you've got a foundation
of best practices.
And then from there,
we will use a tool called RiverMeadow.
And what we'll do with RiverMeadow is
it does block level replication
so that we can move a workload
from your on-premise location to AWS,
and we can do optimization,
so we can optimize that workload in flight
while we're migrating it.
And it's one of the more complex things
that is typically done without tooling,
but RiverMeadow helps us solve it is that

if we can in-flight change the
version of Windows or Linux
or SQL Server, et cetera in-flight,
and even multi-step upgrades so that
if you have one version over here,

but you really need
another version over there,

that RiverMeadow helps us do
that block level replication
and upgrades in-flight to the tune of

we can do hundreds of
workloads migrating per week
with RiverMeadow.
- That's quite cool.

You essentially first
qualify the customers,
you take RiverMeadow as an ISV tool
and accelerate them into AWS,
and when you do that,

you ensure that everything
is already set up
on AWS, landing zone,

and all the best
practices that people need
to get started on AWS.
All right, so once they're on AWS,
how do you help them optimize further?
- That's a great question.
And so part of that is twofold.
First I'll talk about our other ISV vendor
called Monty Cloud, which really,

we'll set up the tooling in
the migrate and modernize phase

and really extend it into manage
and optimize for 12 months.
This is a tool that you can use,
I guess I should say the name here.

So Monty Cloud is a tool that
we will provide a license

for you bundled in as part of
this rapid migration offer.

And what Monty Cloud will help
you do is it's gonna give you
a management plane for all these workloads
that were migrated to AWS.
So you'll be able to see all your VMs
and infrastructure

right within a single pane
of glass using Monty Cloud.
And the best part of it that it has
is well-architected best practices.

So it has an ability to go
scan your infrastructure
for well-architected best practices.

And this is helpful
because once we migrate,

you're gonna continue to
make changes on the cloud.

And what we want as a
partner is to make sure

that you're always building
with best practices,

and if things get out of sync,
we've got tooling in place
to help you streamline your footprint
and enforce best practices.
We can also do some cost optimization.

We can do cost optimization
with this tool.
And there's also built in remediations

for those best practices
and cost optimization.

So what I like to say is
there's a lot of tools out there
that will tell you you have a problem
through some sort of scanning capability.

But what Monty Cloud has is
automations to go fix it.
And then on top of that,
what we have separately
is we're gonna bundle in two months

of Rackspace Managed
Services as another block.
And we call our managed services ModOps.
And this is basically,

our customers are gonna
get two months of ModOps
post-migration that it is

access to the Rackspace
engineering team to where we can
monitor your footprint,

make continuous improvements,
do upgrades, deploy SEPs,

or other things on AWS to
improve your footprint.
And what's nice about some new AWS funding
is that there's a way to extend this
for an additional 12 months
and get some funding to pay

for additional ModOps
services at a discount
because of your gracious AWS funding.
- That is quite amazing.
The whole offer is very compelling.
You are taking customers all the way

from qualification stage
to making sure everything

that they need on AWS is
there in an automated manner.
Then you accelerate the whole migration
and modernization using RiverMeadow,
and you use Monty Cloud to again,
accelerate cost optimization
and making sure they're following
all the well-architected best practices,
and to top it off with

another two months of
your ModOps services.
That is amazing.
It's a very compelling offer, I must say.
- Excellent. Thank you.
And I get to this often,
there's always one more thing.
One thing that I didn't mention is
that throughout this whole process of RMO,

we've been talking a
lot about VMware-centric
migration of workloads.
But we also have accelerators

to help you do things like
containerization, modernization,

adopting Lambda function,
serverless, et cetera.
So we know that our customers,

they might need to get out
of a data center quickly.

We can leverage the rapid
migration offer to move them,

but we also have accelerators
to grow and mature,
where we have hundreds

of reference architecture,
code bases, et cetera,
that if customers want to grow and mature
and try new technologies,

we have accelerators baked
into this to where, as needed,

we can build in the use
of these accelerators

to have customers start
using new technologies,
not just moving their footprint.
And so we can build that in
either through the rapid migration offer
or we'll do that work in ModOps.
So really you don't have to be stuck

with the infrastructure
that you've migrated.
You can land and expand.
- That is very unique.
I think that's one of the USP
that I see here where Rackspace is scaling
using their services,

but they're making sure for
everything that they're doing,
they're using tools to accelerate,
they're using automations to accelerate.
So great, great job there.
- Thank you.
We hope you like the offer

and look forward to deploying
it to many more customers.
- Sure.

So for our audience, if
they want to contact you,
what's the best way to contact you
for the offer that is out there?

- Yeah, the best way to
contact us is actually through

our dedicated email address
at rrmo@rackspace.com.

- Thank you so much.
- Yeah, thank you.
